author: Boone Bergsma
title: Carbonland Trust Carbon Credits DEX
description: Trees are being cut down at a rapid pace, forests are disappearing, co2 is increasing, the ecosystems that clean our air are in major danger

assessments.note: this proposal is an innovative approach which uses DeFi to address the climate warming issues. Users of the tokens will have the ability to earn rewards from the carbon credits their NFT'd land produces. What is missing a sense of scale and scope, the proposal would be easier to follow if voters could get a sense of where carbon credits are being used in traditional markets, and how valuable they are to buyers. This would then lay out what the potential capitalization of the credits would be, and let participants gain a sense of how valuable this idea might be.

The author proposes a system where portions of a forest representing 1lb of CO2 emissions are represented as an NFT to protect it from being cut down over a timespan of a century. The NFTs would have possible price fluctuations and be, I suppose, tradable through means of a game. A very original take on forest conservation.

The proposal outlines an interesting DeFi economy.  If land tokens as small as 1 acre would open the system to many, but those most in need of DeFi services are probably not landholders. If land stewardship is to be verifiable in anyway, this hampers global participation because easement rules are highly variable or nonexistent  in different jurisdictions.

The problem statement is clear and the solution is within the scope of the challenge, however the only aspect of this proposal related to DeFi would be the DEX and there is not enough information on the DEX development or description of how the proposal will address the items and metrics described in the challenge brief. Due to the lack of details on the development of DEX there is no way to indicate that this proposal will have a relevant impact on the challenge.

This proposal was previously submitted to the Fund3 Dapps creation challenge. My recommendation is to submit the proposal to the Dapps challenge again, as there is a much more evident alignment with this challenge.
This is a single idea, not scaling up the DeFI ecosystem.

"Carbonland" is an innovative and important concept for how DeFi can be used to motivate positive environmental improvement. This is an excellent use of the Cardano DeFi capabilities and would showcase how the Cardano network can be utilized.

Without knowing what types of land or where the targeted land for this proposal is, it is difficult to asses whether local laws will support or degrade the proposal. It isn't clear where or who owns the targeted lands, which makes if very difficult to asses how local land law will behave with this proposal. Having a description of the target types of land would bring clarity to how big this system might be.

The author is known from ADA MakerSpace and has proven to be a valuable community member in the past. However forest conservation is popular in the short term, it is not guaranteed that this trend would last over an extended period of time. I have some modest doubts about what would happen if the game loses momentum in popularity. 
It could reduce people's investment to the sole aspect of nature conservation and no longer render it profitable.

feasibility: 2/5
More specific experience in smart contracts and NFT development would benefit the proposal.  Quantification of CO2 sequestration and variable rules regarding easements and stewardship make establishing the legitimacy of the project very difficult, especially if the goal is to promote participation by small land holders globally. At least in the USA there are tax benefits associated with easements which would incentivize participation by landowners.  A more open system without active enforcement may be an option but the system would be vulnerable to abuse and it may be considered disingenuous to sell carbon credits based off of such an open/unenforceable standard.

The proposer has experience with blockchain and carbon credits, but there is no information about the team's skill in developing smart contracts, which compromises the feasibility assessment of the proposal.

The proposal seeks to develop an MVP, native assests and smart contracts, but there is no detailed information on the development of the DEX. In addition, it is important to note that DEXs are not used for NFTs, but marketplaces. For a token to be traded on a DEX it needs fungibility.

No budget breakdown has been presented.

No plan on how this will be monitored. What is the oracle to check the land is kept forested. constantly updated georeferenced Satellite imagery combined with computer vision algorithms could conceivably do this, but the proposer has not detailed this.

While this is a great idea, the proposal didn't provide a sense of scale for how much companies are paying for carbon credits today, which makes it difficult to assess what the total market capitalization might be for the CO2 and ACRE tokens.

The proposal also didn't identify how many acres will be targeted for the 100 year trusts.

I am missing a bit of a risk assessment and legal framework around it, which is important for a project like this. 
If a landowner decides to cut down a portion of the forest regardless, would that get him sued and the NFT holder compensated? 
Suppose a tree suffers from disease or is damaged by lightning so that it endangers the trees around it, would that enable the landwoner to cut down the tree? How would this be determined? I have noticed that the GPS coordinates do not match an exact grid. It's a stretch, but wouldn't that enable the landowner to cut down the trees inbetween the grid boxes? 
How about different legalities in different countries? 
It's a cool idea, but it still needs polishing on that aspect in my opinion.

Auditability 4/5
Since the funding requested is specifically for the development of the NFT/Dapp system, production of such system would mean the realization of the proposal goals. Because the proposer has 50 acres of land to use as a pilot, they have a good opportunity to test and implement the software. However the more challenging aspect of the proposal would come in future stages. Auditability of carbon sequestration and stewardship practices will propose a significant challenge to the ultimate success of the proposer's vision.

There is no budget breakdown, no metrics, no KPIs, no roadmap. There is little information about the proposers and their roles in the development of the project.

The plan needs to be more detailed, and the information mentioned above needs to be included so that the proposal can be audited.
No detailed implementation or marketing plan.

A detailed allocation of the budget and a timeline of objectives is not provided, which diminishes the ability to assess progress. Nevertheless, the written description of the goals is high quality the goal of establishing NFTs that represent Carbon Credits is clear.

solution: Carbonland Trust's DEX to trade carbon credit NFTs based on actual Forest being conserved will inspire & fund conservation efforts all over
experience: Have won two hackathons recently for ideas relating to blockchain and carbon credits, and acquired 50 acres of forest to conserve in a pilot
